intro: Ribes leiobotrys, commonly known as the narrowleaf currant, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Grossulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers in early spring, which are followed by edible, red berries in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. Its ornamental value and edible fruits make it a valuable plant in both horticulture and ecological settings.
